availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George Blackburn Kinkead (Fayette County, KY, attorney and trustee of Transy University)

body.p: Fayette County, Kentucky, attorney and university curator. Kentucky native. Married to Eliza Pearce Kinkead. Father of R. S. Kinkead, John Kinkead, E. T. Kinkead, A. P. Kinkead, Margaret “Maggie” Kinkead, William B. Kinkead, Mary Kinkead, Frank Kinkead, and James Kinkead. Attorney in Lexington in 1850. Owned seven enslaved persons in Lexington in 1850. Attorney in Lexington in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Lexington in 1860. Trustee of Transylvania University in 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District 2, p. 198A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District 2.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, Lexington, p. 575.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, Lexington, p. 456A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, Lexington Ward 3, p. 290B.
